intro: Rubus obscurus var. derasidens, commonly known as the dark bramble or blackberry shrub, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of native ecosystems.
